zone.line: still I desired love & fellowship, & I was still
spurnned — Was there no injustice in this?
Am I to be thought the only criminal when
all human kind sinned against me? — Why
you not hate Felix who drove his friend
his door with contumely? Why do you not
execrate the rustic who sought to destroy
savior of his child? Nay, these are virtuo
& immaculate beings. I the miserable & the
abandoned am an abortion to be spurned
& kicked & trampled upon — Even now my
boils at the recollection of this injustice.
But it is true that I am a wretch. I
have murdered the lovely and the helpless. I have
strangled the innocent as they slept, & grasped
to death the his throat who never injured me
or any other living thing. I have devoted
my creator, a spec the select specimen of all
that is worthy of love & admiration among men,
to misery: I have pursued him even to that
irremdiable ruin. There he lies, white & cold
